author: sky.cactus
content: Is the idea that you create a SNARK/STARK proof of state verification so you don't have to do the actual state verification and instead only need to do the proof validation (which could potentially include many state proofs in one STARK proof)?

author: sky.cactus
content: I guess whether it is cheaper to do a SNARK/STARK proof than a state proof depends on how much state entries you are proving.  If you are just proving a single entry with a binary tree then I suspect it is cheaper (smaller proof size and cheaper proof validation) to do a direct MPT proof than the stark/snark, but if you are proving a whole bunch of state then the snark/stark is better?
